intro: Hippeophyllum, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Hippeophyllum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
